Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with plenty of water and sunlight, showing it healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, demonstrating what happens when a plant doesn't receive water.
The student can draw a plant without sunlight, illustrating the effects of no light on a plant's growth.
The student can use observations to show patterns of how plants respond to the presence or absence of water and light.
The student can identify and depict differences in plant growth when water and/or light is missing.
